title: (WIP) [*] CORE : Improved DbQuery class + parameterized queries
body:
## Description
Upgrade the `DbQuery` class with some extra functionality. Based on Doctrine's SQL Query Builder.
It is 100% compatible with pre-1.7's `DbQuery` and ~90% compatible with Doctrine's SQL Query Builder.

The `DbQuery` has been designed in such a way that it is very easy to create SQL templates and add parameters in order to execute parameterized queries.

Parameterized queries can lead to a significant performance improvement and is a great defense against SQL injections.

`Db::update` and `Db::insert` are automatically parameterized, thus automatically preventing SQL injections and improving performance with repeated queries.

## How to use it / Best practice
Create an SQL template:
``` PHP
$sql = new DbQuery();
$sql->select('id_product');
$sql->from('product'),
$sql->where('id_product = ? OR id_product = ?');
```
Then set the parameters:
``` PHP
$sql->setParameter(1, Db::TYPE_INTEGER);
$sql->setParameter(2, Db::TYPE_INTEGER);
```
You can also set the parameters as follows:
``` PHP
$sql->setParameters([1,2], [Db::TYPE_INTEGER, Db::TYPE_INTEGER]);
```
The order is important. The available types are limited by `MySQLi`'s types.
More info on (most of) the possibilities can be found here: http://doctrine-orm.readthedocs.org/projects/doctrine-dbal/en/latest/reference/query-builder.html
The compatibility and limitations can be found in the PHPDoc comments.

## Limitations
- PDO's named parameters are not supported, only question mark parameters
- Support for the old `mysql` extension needs to be dropped

## Steps to Test this Feature

1. Try a `SELECT` or `DELETE` through `DbQuery`
2. Try to `UPDATE` or `INSERT` with `Db`

title: [-] CORE: valid orders amount currency fix (PSCSX-7738)
body:
If a shop is multi-currency and customer pays in an other than the default, the valid orders amount is displaying the amount with default currency ISO code.

1. customer pays 100 EURO, default store currency is DKK = displaying customers valid order is worth 100 DKK, instead of 100 EURO - since stores can have many currencies i figured out it was best to convert the orders back to the default currency instead of guessing the most valid currency for each customer

Forge ticket: http://forge.prestashop.com/browse/PSCSX-7738

title: [*] CORE : Redis cache manager
body:
# Redis Cache in Prestashop

## What ?
We want to implement a reliable way to use Redis Cache into Prestashop. There is a PECL package for PHP which is old enough now to be reliable in production.

## Why ?
Redis is faster, less restrictive, reliable and stable.
(see here for more technical infos : http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10558465/memcached-vs-redis)

## How ?
Include it aside of Memcached, APC and file system cache already included in Prestashop.
Like @firstred did on his own plugin, as it's done with Memcached, we should also implement multi-server redis feature. 
Localhost should also be specified by default.


# TODO 
- New SQL DB for Multi server ( @xBorderie this is the point where we need help indications )
- Form in controllers/admin/AdminPerformanceController.php
- Multi server in classes/cache/CacheRedis.php > Following @firstred proposal
- Speficy and test localhost first

title: [*] On-the-fly image resizing OK with php-fpm + apache
body:
The travis tests made me realize that we have 404's on all images with the apache + php-fpm setup.

This fixes it on apache + php-fpm.

Since this part of the code is a bit complicated, I'd like to confirm that images are not broken on:

- [ ] apache + php-fpm / with URL rewriting
- [x] apache + php-fpm / no URL rewriting
- [x] apache + mod php / with URL rewriting
- [ ] apache + mod php / no URL rewriting
- [ ] nginx / with URL rewriting
rewriting
- [ ] <s>nginx / no URL rewriting</s>

Can anybody check it out?

The tests consist in removing all images from img/, then installing PrestaShop and seeing if front-end images are OK.

title: FO: Introduce new `hook_block` for Smarty
WS: Add ability to manage Attachments via Webservice
body:
| Questions | Answers | ------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- | Branch? | develop (should also be in 1.6.1.x however) | Description? | This pull request adds the ability to manage and download Attachments via Webservice. It also adds Attachments associations to Products and reverse (Product association for Attachments). | Type? | new feature | Category? | WS | BC breaks? | No, it's unlikely | Deprecations? | No | Fixed ticket? | No tickets, but multiple forum entries concerning this.
https://www.prestashop.com/forums/topic/322464-products-attachments-webservice/
https://www.prestashop.com/forums/topic/503882-webservice-for-downloading-product-attachments/
https://www.prestashop.com/forums/topic/430091-webservice-add-product-attachment/
https://www.prestashop.com/forums/topic/433842-products-attachments-via-web-service-possibile/
https://www.prestashop.com/forums/topic/275248-api-and-products-attachments/
https://www.prestashop.com/forums/topic/433666-file-upload-via-web-service/

Probably missed some topics also. | How to test? | Use Webservice to add/update Attachments, check attachment associations for products via webservice. I should probably mention that not all of the functionality added has been thoroughly tested, however I've tested the binary upload and the fetching part of both endpoints. ## Notes: This is one of the essential parts which seem to be missing from PrestaShop in terms of Webservice. Most other management can already be done through webservice, but Attachments are not handled yet. In order to reuse functionality of WebserviceRequest for the handling of details; i.e. Attachment details handled via xml/json, some methods and variables of WebserviceRequest requires enhanced visibility in order to be used through the WebserviceSpecificManagementInterface. I can't see how this would not be backwards compatible, but perhaps someone else has more knowledge. In order handle default request for presenting and updating Attachment details, I decided to emulate such a request by unassigning the $objectSpecificManagement within the specific management and later calling the WebserviceRequest default operation. Variables/Methods required to be **public** (WebserviceRequest.php): _$objectSpecificManagement returnOutput() entityExecutePost() entityExecutePut() entityExecuteDelete()_ The binary handling of Attachment files has been more or less copied from the AdminAttachmentsController with the addition of some comments. For the specific management part of the addition, I studied the specific management of images and tried to follow its structure for it to seemlessly integrate into the project. Furthermore I hope that this could also work its way into the 1.6.1.x branch and releases as I see this as a critical feature that should have been implemented earlier.

title: [*] TR : Country names from CLDR
body:
## Description
While checking out CLDR I saw that it contains localized country names as well.
PrestaShop is missing a lot of translations so CLDR also seems to be useful here for country names.
I made a quick 'n dirty Node.js script to generate the translation files: https://gist.github.com/firstred/0b47dac668a520378c788859767a672d

## Steps to Test this Feature
Step 1. Go to Duolingo
Step 2. Complete every course
Step 3. With your newly gained language skills, check all the country names
OR
Step 1. Check out the gist used for the generation of the files: https://gist.github.com/firstred/0b47dac668a520378c788859767a672d
Step 2. Check if the language codes are mapped correctly
Step 3. Check if all files are correct

Whichever you prefer 😜

title: [-] BO : Fix backoffice order with deleted address
body: If you want to add an order via backoffice and you have chosen an existing customer, his carts and orders are loaded. But if the address of the cart is not existing anymore (marked as deleted), there is no chance to edit it. This code change makes sure, that an existing backup address is loaded properly.

title: [+] CORE : Add hooks for URL rewriting modules
body:
## Description
Adds hooks for those who are brave enough to change PrestaShop's URL schema.
It should provide a toolkit that is extensive enough to radically change PrestaShop's URLs without the need for overrides.

## Steps to Test this Fix
Step 1. Take a rewriting module
Step 2. Migrate the overrides to the hooks
Step 3. Should get the same results

title: [+] FO : Adds extra exculed keys for canonicalRedirection
[-] WS : Fix webservice unit_price_ratio set to 0
body:
Product class contains associated tables (manufacturer, supplier, categories, etc). In the core ObjectModel when class that have associated tables is updated it loads fields and merges them with Shop specific fields.
=> file `classes/ObjectModel.php` line 250

ObjectModel is abstract, inherited by original classes like Product.

In Product class there is method `getFieldsShop()` line 517
This method checks if there are update fields. In your test case there are no update fields because you pass same data as original Product record so it goes to line 521:
```
$fields['unit_price_ratio'] = (float)$this->unit_price > 0 ? $this->price / $this->unit_price : 0;
```

But `$this->unit_price` is NULL in webservice call because this property is set in Product's `__constructor()` (line 500) ONLY id second parameter of constructor is true (`$full = true`)

However in `classes/webservice/WebserviceRequest.php` line 1408 the constructor is called with only 1 parameter, the record id: 
```
$object = new $this->resourceConfiguration['retrieveData']['className']((int)$attributes->id);
```
$full is false by default and unit_price is 0 so unit_price_ratio is also 0.

I used part of the code (2 lines) located in Product's `__construct()` and added these 2 lines in `updateWS()`. This guarantees that the change is executed only on webservice update. The 2 lines are:

```
$this->price = Product::getPriceStatic((int)$this->id, false, null, 6, null, false, true, 1, false, null, null, null, $this->specificPrice);
$this->unit_price = ($this->unit_price_ratio != 0  ? $this->price / $this->unit_price_ratio : 0);
```

These 2 lines are added in `classes/Product.php` in `public function updateWs()` after line 5847

unit_price is a calculated field, it does not exist in db. But it is calculated only if Product record is loaded with `$full=true` in `__construct()` method.
Later in the update process, the code checks if no unit_price set, then unit_price_ratio is set to 0.

title: [-] BO: Duplicated Payments
body:
This error only happens when the orders status workflow is altered to invoice AFTER sending (useful in COD payment method)
In this scenario, as a sent order needs an invoice to set the delivery slip number and delivery date, an invoice is created in this part of the code.

This modifications to `changeIdOrderState` doesn't affect the normal behaviour where invoices are generated first. Here is why:

* the method `setDeliverySlip()` generates an invoice, set delivery date and set delivery number IF there are no invoices.
* This invoice generation doesn't check for previous payments, so a new payment is added <--- here is the problem
* the method `setInvoice($use_existing_payment)` generate an invoice and check for previous payments, so no duplicate payment is generated, but doesn't add the delivery number and delivery date. It doesn't matter: latter in the same function `changeIdOrderState` there is a call to `setDelivery()`, which does exactly those things.

There were various ways to solve this:

* use a different way to store delivery slips (and not using an invoice for that)
* if an invoice is needed before sending, force payment method's statuses to always invoice.
this PR :)

Note: after doing this PR, looks like there is no other call `$order->setDeliverySlip()` in the whole project, so it might be deleted...

title: Change setWsCategories because bad product positions in category
body: Fixing Product::setWsCategories() : for existing category associations product will maintain its current position, for new ones it will be placed at the end of the list (current behaviour is completly bugged, using array index as position)
